intro: Crambe tataria var. taurica, commonly known as Tatarian mustard, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has also been used in traditional herbal medicine.
